main event: A member of the staff at the Te Awamutu Observatory in New Zealand saw a bright, self-luminous object moving rapidly in the sky in December 1950.
interesting points: The object appeared to change direction and altitude during the sighting, which lasted for approximately one minute.
The object was first seen at an altitude of about 30 degrees above the horizon and then disappeared from view at an angle of about 15 degrees above the horizon.
The report includes four black and white photographs depicting a rural landscape, with a possible disc-shaped object in the sky.
The sighting was reported to the New Zealand Department of Scientific and Industrial Research.
The report is from Project Blue Book, a US Air Force program that investigated unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in the 1950s.
witnesses: a member of the staff at the Te Awamutu Observatory
photographs: yes, the report includes four black and white photographs
